intro: Wislizenia refracta var. palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's false dawnflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid environments. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers and has a sprawling growth habit. Its botanical features make it well adapted to drought conditions and harsh desert climates.
